citeinfo.title: National Land Cover Database (NLCD 2021) for Alabama Wildlife Management Areas

descript.abstract: This dataset includes a clipped subset of the 2021 National Land Cover Database (NLCD), covering Wildlife Management Areas (WMAs) across the state of Alabama. The NLCD provides a 30-meter resolution classification of land cover across the United States and is widely used in land use, ecological, and remote sensing analyses. This version of the NLCD was used as an input layer in the land cover classification model and for comparative analysis of modeled classes within WMAs.
descript.purpose: The NLCD dataset was used to provide contextual land cover information and serve as a reference layer in the development and evaluation of a supervised classification model. It supports interpretation of land use patterns and vegetation structure across Alabama's Wildlife Management Areas.

place.placekey: Charles D. Kelley Autauga Wildlife Management Area

attracc.attraccr: NLCD data are produced and validated by the USGS using standardized classification procedures and national-scale accuracy assessments. The original class values and metadata are retained in this dataset, and no edits were made to class codes or definitions. Accuracy is as reported by the MRLC Consortium.

dataqual.logic: The NLCD raster was clipped and reprojected in ArcGIS Pro to match the study area extent and projection. No data loss or corruption occurred during processing. Raster alignment and pixel integrity were verified visually and through spatial statistics.
dataqual.complete: The dataset includes all NLCD 2021 land cover classes present within the boundaries of Alabama’s Wildlife Management Areas. It represents the most recent and complete nationwide land cover dataset available as of 2024. No data gaps are present within the defined extent.

procstep.procdesc: NLCD 2021 Land Cover (30 m) raster data were downloaded from the Multi-Resolution Land Characteristics (MRLC) Consortium website. The original CONUS layer was imported into ArcGIS Pro and clipped to the extent of Alabama’s Wildlife Management Areas. The raster was reprojected to match the coordinate system used in the project (NAD 1983 UTM Zone 16N), and class values were retained as published. No reclassification or resampling was performed. The resulting raster was used alongside Landsat and field-derived data in the classification model.

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Buildling 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data for other purposes, nor on all computer systems, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
